elements.label: Meteoric Scattergun
elements.description: A 'noble weapon' assembled in the factories of the Far West, designed to fire in a wide, lethal spread. Five taenite-packed shotshells sit in the magazine. [When used to successfully attack an Enemy, this weapon will sometimes also strike and kill another Enemy.]

elements.label: Wormsplitter
elements.description: A trencher's axe used during the Third Worm War. The weapon is strix-blest: it hums excitedly in hand, and cleaves both mortal and unmortal flesh with ease that mundane steel is not normally capable of. And it always smells slightly of carrion.

elements.label: Division Bell
elements.description: First its voice, and then, nothing.

elements.label: Division Bell (Exhausted)
elements.description: First its voice, and then, nothing.

elements.label: Dragon's Teeth
elements.description: Dagger-length spikes of gleaming white wyrm-bone. They won't grow if I plant them, but they still pierce with the force of an older, savager time.

elements.label: Dragon's Teeth (Exhausted)

elements.label: Skaptodon Femur
elements.description: A leg bone taken from one the Lionsmith's mightiest servants. Its structural integrity could only be compromised by the most savage forces. It also doubles very excellently as a club.

elements.label: Skaptodon Femur (Exhausted)

elements.label: Spear of Agonies
elements.description: The legendary armament of the Smith's Hound, stolen away to the Continent from the Land of Saints amidst the plots and schisms of the Intercalate. Those struck by this weapon suffer indescribable agony before death - and long, long after. [When this weapon is used to kill an Enemy, it will produce a Wolf-Wrake as an Ally.]

elements.label: Spear of Agonies (Exhausted)
elements.description: The legendary armament of the Blacksmith's Hound, stolen away to the Continent from the Land of Saints amidst the plots and schisms of the Intercalate. Those struck by this weapon suffer indescribable agony before death - and long, long after. [When this weapon is used to kill an Enemy, it will produce a Wolf-Wrake as an Ally.]

elements.label: Agonising Components
elements.description: Searing, sparking motes of light. It could be more, if I had enough on hand.

elements.label: Hair-of-the-Wolf
elements.description: A shining, golden spine long enough to be hefted and thrown like a javelin, capable of instantly annihilating whatever it pierces. To hold one at all produces excruciating pain, but it is said that Kelemdu, Wolf of the Marches, hunted with these barehanded. [This is a weapon that can only be used once.]

elements.label: Sergei's Shashka
elements.description: The favoured fang of Sergei Dvorak, the Iron-Eater, who has now passed from the world into History. An indescribably wretched weapon wielded by an indescribably wretched man. In my hand, it feels welcome. [This weapon may produce the Wolf's Shadow whenever it is used.]

elements.label: Sergei's Shashka (Exhausted)
elements.description: The favoured fang of Sergei Dvorak, the Iron-Eater, who has now passed from the world into History. An indescribably wretched weapon wielded by an indescribably wretched man. In my hand, it feels welcome. [This weapon may produce the Wolf's Shadow whenever it is used.]

elements.label: Hybrid-Flail
elements.description: The 'spear' wielded by the Cross-warrior Gyrvaengr: a viper-quick length of tail and stinger, hissing with venom furious enough to crack stone. Severed from the body, it can now be used a kind of morbid flail, crushing and corroding whatever is unlucky enough to suffer its seething impact.
